KH.content: Platonism, which still can be referred to, would refer to the misprision, the thesis torn out by artifice from written fiction of “Plato,” and, under the name of philosophy, a certain force of thetic abstraction in his texts recommends one to do so
KH.linkedContent: Platonism, which still can be referred to, would refer to the misprision, the thesis torn out by artifice from written fiction of “Plato,” and, under the name of philosophy, a certain force of thetic abstraction in his texts recommends one to do so

KH.content: “Platonism” a necessary effect of Plato’s texts has dominated (in name of philosophy) by way of arbitrary violence (making the law) other motifs at work in the text
KH.linkedContent: “Platonism” a necessary effect of Plato’s texts has dominated (in name of philosophy) by way of arbitrary violence (making the law) other motifs at work in the text

KH.content: turns back against the text, w/ a violent reversion that’s always interested & interesting [says same thing about Nietzsche]
KH.linkedContent: turns back against the text, w/ a violent reversion that’s always interested & interesting [says same thing about Nietzsche]

KH.content: “Platonism” not only neutralizes Plato’s texts, inhibiting forces that continue to maintain a certain disorder (parasitism, ventriloquism, clandestinity, tone of denial), “Platonism” commands whole history of this neutralization, a philosophy would always be “Platonic”
KH.linkedContent: “Platonism” not only neutralizes Plato’s texts, inhibiting forces that continue to maintain a certain disorder (parasitism, ventriloquism, clandestinity, tone of denial), “Platonism” commands whole history of this neutralization, a philosophy would always be “Platonic”

GT.content: Mallarmé links aesthetics w/ political economy via alchemy: alchemy as precursor to political economy, “null stone, dreaming of gold, once called philosophical…foreshadows, in finance, the future credit, preceding capital or reducing it to the humility of money!”
GT.linkedContent: Mallarmé links aesthetics w/ political economy via alchemy: alchemy as precursor to political economy, “null stone, dreaming of gold, once called philosophical…foreshadows, in finance, the future credit, preceding capital or reducing it to the humility of money!”

SPOM.content: how “death of philosophy” induces an excess that keeps philosophy living-on
SPOM.linkedContent: how “death of philosophy” induces an excess that keeps philosophy living-on

SPOM.content: ends of philosophy, Blanchot: accomplishment of absolute knowledge, its theoretical suppression linked to its practical realization, the nihilist movement in which all values are engulfed, culmination of metaphysics as precursor sign of something else
SPOM.linkedContent: ends of philosophy, Blanchot: accomplishment of absolute knowledge, its theoretical suppression linked to its practical realization, the nihilist movement in which all values are engulfed, culmination of metaphysics as precursor sign of something else

POO.content: identifiable institutions stabilize, arrest turbulence, master, order, to be able to make decisions, to be able > literature is exemplary in the face of this, it always does something other, something other than itself: for example: philosophy (literature & philosophy)
POO.linkedContent: identifiable institutions stabilize, arrest turbulence, master, order, to be able to make decisions, to be able > literature is exemplary in the face of this, it always does something other, something other than itself: for example: philosophy (literature & philosophy)

HERP.content: acc. Heidegger, philosophy addresses itself to us as a summons, we respond, in a correspondence (Entsprechen), lend an ear, w/ that toward which philosophy is underway (unterwegs)
HERP.linkedContent: acc. Heidegger, philosophy addresses itself to us as a summons, we respond, in a correspondence (Entsprechen), lend an ear, w/ that toward which philosophy is underway (unterwegs)

HERP.content: a philein not yet philia, which philosophy (too young, too late) has no authority to question, because [philosophy] is born like an event coming over philein
HERP.linkedContent: a philein not yet philia, which philosophy (too young, too late) has no authority to question, because [philosophy] is born like an event coming over philein

HERP.content: caught in ring of circle once questioning philosophy, engaged by Greek tongue > acc. Heidegger, obscurely, authoritatively, Greek tongue alone is logos
HERP.linkedContent: caught in ring of circle once questioning philosophy, engaged by Greek tongue > acc. Heidegger, obscurely, authoritatively, Greek tongue alone is logos

HERP.content: for Heidegger, Heraclitus and poets [?] experience lovence (aimance), before philosophy, love w/out strife before Eros, desire, or, at least, a jealous tension
HERP.linkedContent: for Heidegger, Heraclitus and poets [?] experience lovence (aimance), before philosophy, love w/out strife before Eros, desire, or, at least, a jealous tension

HERP.content: to strive to recall—nostalgia; Aristotle, metaphysics: reactive nostalgia, a mourning for originary philein, semideafness that hears but not the originary gathering of logos
HERP.linkedContent: to strive to recall—nostalgia; Aristotle, metaphysics: reactive nostalgia, a mourning for originary philein, semideafness that hears but not the originary gathering of logos

HERP.content: philosophy “stand[s] in the tensing of this nostalgic tension,” Suchen, orexis, search, quest, investigation is tension of a desire
HERP.linkedContent: philosophy “stand[s] in the tensing of this nostalgic tension,” Suchen, orexis, search, quest, investigation is tension of a desire

HERP.content: for Heidegger, philosophy seeks after, comes later than harmony, this delay eroticizes philosophical search, tension of Eros; Heraclitus & Parmenides not philosophers, no straining, no erotic pas, in accord, Einklang, homology w/ logos
HERP.linkedContent: for Heidegger, philosophy seeks after, comes later than harmony, this delay eroticizes philosophical search, tension of Eros; Heraclitus & Parmenides not philosophers, no straining, no erotic pas, in accord, Einklang, homology w/ logos

POOF.content: question “What is (tí estin) friendship?” & “Who is the friend (either sex)?” is nothing but the question “What is philosophy?”
POOF.linkedContent: question “What is (tí estin) friendship?” & “Who is the friend (either sex)?” is nothing but the question “What is philosophy?”

POOF.content: [offering quasi-summary of HERP] moment that originary [Heraclitean] phileîn (accord, favour, solicitude Gunst) becomes jealous, nostalgic tension ‘determined by Eros [órexis]’: the step to philosophy, prepared by sophistry [Plato, Socrates] > is the strange voice of the friend, an ontological call [prior to subject, consciousness, even to Mitsein? see p. 243], interior & w/out, the “what is…?” of philosophy [?]
POOF.linkedContent: [offering quasi-summary of HERP] moment that originary [Heraclitean] phileîn (accord, favour, solicitude Gunst) becomes jealous, nostalgic tension ‘determined by Eros [órexis]’: the step to philosophy, prepared by sophistry [Plato, Socrates] > is the strange voice of the friend, an ontological call [prior to subject, consciousness, even to Mitsein? see p. 243], interior & w/out, the “what is…?” of philosophy [?]

POOF.content: as always for Heidegger, the gathering of lógos prevails, even if it accords the tensions of a false note
POOF.linkedContent: as always for Heidegger, the gathering of lógos prevails, even if it accords the tensions of a false note

POOF.content: is Heidegger’s Zusage (prior to the question) that agency of phileîn which is not yet the eroticized tension of philosophy?
POOF.linkedContent: is Heidegger’s Zusage (prior to the question) that agency of phileîn which is not yet the eroticized tension of philosophy?

BL.content: text of philosophy, science, or history, a text of knowledge or information, would not abandon a name to a state of not-knowing—not intentionally [see p. 209]
BL.linkedContent: text of philosophy, science, or history, a text of knowledge or information, would not abandon a name to a state of not-knowing—not intentionally [see p. 209]

MPM.content: de Man: “deconstruction of metaphysics” is impossible because in being rhetorical (btwn trope & persuasion) it is literary (doesn’t resolve relation btwn literature & philosophy)
MPM.linkedContent: de Man: “deconstruction of metaphysics” is impossible because in being rhetorical (btwn trope & persuasion) it is literary (doesn’t resolve relation btwn literature & philosophy)

EM.content: possibility of international philosophical colloquium must take place in a medium > universality of philosophical discourse, linked to group of languages & “cultures”
EM.linkedContent: possibility of international philosophical colloquium must take place in a medium > universality of philosophical discourse, linked to group of languages & “cultures”

EM.content: interest in universality of anthropos a sign of West’s attempt to interiorize, master what’s different from it, l’effet de cette différence d’un tout autre ordre, where philosophical colloquium has no meaning, this other space neither barren, nor desert-like
EM.linkedContent: interest in universality of anthropos a sign of West’s attempt to interiorize, master what’s different from it, l’effet de cette différence d’un tout autre ordre, where philosophical colloquium has no meaning, this other space neither barren, nor desert-like

EM.content: if the orders let us do it [philosophize], they’re not troubled by it
EM.linkedContent: if the orders let us do it [philosophize], they’re not troubled by it

PP.content: pharmakon: antisubstance, resists any philosopheme, exceeding bounds as nonidentity: inexhaustible adversity of funds of philosophy, infinite absence of what founds philosophy
PP.linkedContent: pharmakon: antisubstance, resists any philosopheme, exceeding bounds as nonidentity: inexhaustible adversity of funds of philosophy, infinite absence of what founds philosophy

PP.content: difficulty of translating pharmakon (“remedy,” “drug,” “recipe,” “philter”) w/in Greek itself > violent transference of a nonphilosopheme into a philosopheme is problem of very passage into philosophy
PP.linkedContent: difficulty of translating pharmakon (“remedy,” “drug,” “recipe,” “philter”) w/in Greek itself > violent transference of a nonphilosopheme into a philosopheme is problem of very passage into philosophy

PP.content: opposition btwn mnēmē and hypomnēsis institutes all oppositions of Platonism, the boundary line is major decision of philosophy, maintains, institutes itself, contains its fond advers
PP.linkedContent: opposition btwn mnēmē and hypomnēsis institutes all oppositions of Platonism, the boundary line is major decision of philosophy, maintains, institutes itself, contains its fond advers

PP.content: philosophy determines itself and its other at the same time
PP.linkedContent: philosophy determines itself and its other at the same time

VM.content: philosophy’s wellspring (ressource) is its death, nonphilosophy, because of its death it has a future, the future has a future
VM.linkedContent: philosophy’s wellspring (ressource) is its death, nonphilosophy, because of its death it has a future, the future has a future

VM.content: difference btwn philosophy as power/adventure of question itself & philosophy as determined event/turning point (tournant) w/in this adventure [difference btwn Nietzsche & Heidegger?]
VM.linkedContent: difference btwn philosophy as power/adventure of question itself & philosophy as determined event/turning point (tournant) w/in this adventure [difference btwn Nietzsche & Heidegger?]

VM.content: that we are consigned to Greek element, a knowledge and confidence that is not comfortable, that torments us > Husserl’s crisis, a covering up of a transcendental motif beginning to accomplish Greek aim in Descartes & Kant: philosophy as science
VM.linkedContent: that we are consigned to Greek element, a knowledge and confidence that is not comfortable, that torments us > Husserl’s crisis, a covering up of a transcendental motif beginning to accomplish Greek aim in Descartes & Kant: philosophy as science

VM.content: can a method be borrowed like a tool? method always shelters, anticipates the being which one encounters > this is why, since Plato, decision of philosophy has always seen itself as a science
VM.linkedContent: can a method be borrowed like a tool? method always shelters, anticipates the being which one encounters > this is why, since Plato, decision of philosophy has always seen itself as a science

VM.content: btwn original tragedy and messianic triumph there is philosophy, in which violence returned against violence, in which original finitude appears, in which other is respected w/in, by, the same ——question of philosophy: why finitude? why must I think transcendental through ego, ipseity?
VM.linkedContent: btwn original tragedy and messianic triumph there is philosophy, in which violence returned against violence, in which original finitude appears, in which other is respected w/in, by, the same ——question of philosophy: why finitude? why must I think transcendental through ego, ipseity?

VM.content: philosophy can only let itself be questioned
VM.linkedContent: philosophy can only let itself be questioned

PAS.content: to think “starting from (à partir de)” Blanchot departs from the reassuring line of thought of philosophy, thinks tout autre
PAS.linkedContent: to think “starting from (à partir de)” Blanchot departs from the reassuring line of thought of philosophy, thinks tout autre

PAS.content: event (de-distance of near) (Eriegnis, Entfernung, Enteignis) “before” which philosophy and its pas au déla (thought) are trying to close themselves
PAS.linkedContent: event (de-distance of near) (Eriegnis, Entfernung, Enteignis) “before” which philosophy and its pas au déla (thought) are trying to close themselves

S.content: acc. Heidegger, Missdeutung of philosophy, as figure of spirit: it is supposed to procure systems, world-pictures (Weltbild), map of world (Weltkarte), be the functionary of fundamental
S.linkedContent: acc. Heidegger, Missdeutung of philosophy, as figure of spirit: it is supposed to procure systems, world-pictures (Weltbild), map of world (Weltkarte), be the functionary of fundamental

T.content: philosophy has always thought its other, that which limits it; does to think the other solely mean relever, to control the other? or does the limit/passage always reserve one more coup; to think the proper of the other, the other as such is to miss it, to miss the missing of the other [on manque (de) le manquer]: examine the relevance of the limit
T.linkedContent: philosophy has always thought its other, that which limits it; does to think the other solely mean relever, to control the other? or does the limit/passage always reserve one more coup; to think the proper of the other, the other as such is to miss it, to miss the missing of the other [on manque (de) le manquer]: examine the relevance of the limit

T.content: if there are margins, is there still a philosophy? the philosophy?
T.linkedContent: if there are margins, is there still a philosophy? the philosophy?

SH.content: philosophy finds itself in vicinity of poetic, of literature, the blurred border (no place, utopia) btwn empirical (contingency of the outer) and necessary (necessity of inner) > indecision of this limit most provokes thought [Derrida attacks the idea that philosophy loses itself there]
SH.linkedContent: philosophy finds itself in vicinity of poetic, of literature, the blurred border (no place, utopia) btwn empirical (contingency of the outer) and necessary (necessity of inner) > indecision of this limit most provokes thought [Derrida attacks the idea that philosophy loses itself there]

FWT.content: rigorously, “philosophy” exists nowhere other than in Greece, yet it tends toward liberating itself from this cultural limitation, will toward deracination [Husserl, Heidegger]
FWT.linkedContent: rigorously, “philosophy” exists nowhere other than in Greece, yet it tends toward liberating itself from this cultural limitation, will toward deracination [Husserl, Heidegger]

FWT.content: the universal of philosophy (neither relativism nor nationalism) not a given, an essence, but an infinite process of universalization > in the name of European filiation we are liberating ourselves from Eurocentrism/ethnocentrism
FWT.linkedContent: the universal of philosophy (neither relativism nor nationalism) not a given, an essence, but an infinite process of universalization > in the name of European filiation we are liberating ourselves from Eurocentrism/ethnocentrism

POS.content: Derrida’s texts belong neither to “philosophical” nor “literary” register, communicate w/ other texts that can be called “philosophical” or “literary” acc. a kind of paleonomy
POS.linkedContent: Derrida’s texts belong neither to “philosophical” nor “literary” register, communicate w/ other texts that can be called “philosophical” or “literary” acc. a kind of paleonomy

P.content: when philosophy views itself as a work of art, it is represented on the model of one of its parts, so is philosophy then just a part of art? [living organism, biological metaphor]
P.linkedContent: when philosophy views itself as a work of art, it is represented on the model of one of its parts, so is philosophy then just a part of art? [living organism, biological metaphor]

ATIA.content: the animal in the general singular, neutralization, castration, of the sex of the animal > the philosopheme itself, constitutes philosophy [no philosopher has every protested on principle]
ATIA.linkedContent: the animal in the general singular, neutralization, castration, of the sex of the animal > the philosopheme itself, constitutes philosophy [no philosopher has every protested on principle]

ATIA.content: in Phaedrus, a comparison of the singing cicada w/ the philosophizing man: as a man I am a cicada
ATIA.linkedContent: in Phaedrus, a comparison of the singing cicada w/ the philosophizing man: as a man I am a cicada

ATIA.content: Heidegger’s Fundamental Concepts… begins by describing philosophy, metaphysics, homesickness and melancholy as forms of nostalgia
ATIA.linkedContent: Heidegger’s Fundamental Concepts… begins by describing philosophy, metaphysics, homesickness and melancholy as forms of nostalgia

GSP.content: “a certain structuralism has always been philosophy’s most spontaneous gesture”
GSP.linkedContent: “a certain structuralism has always been philosophy’s most spontaneous gesture”

FS.content: philosophy as twilight of forces, “sun-splashed (ensoleillé)” morning of images, forms, phenomena > matin des idées et des idoles, où le relief des forces devient repos, aplatit sa profondeur dans la lumière et s'étend dans l’horizontalité
FS.linkedContent: philosophy as twilight of forces, “sun-splashed (ensoleillé)” morning of images, forms, phenomena > matin des idées et des idoles, où le relief des forces devient repos, aplatit sa profondeur dans la lumière et s'étend dans l’horizontalité

O.content: le détour d’une écriture dont one ne revient pas, dissemination: this question calls for restaging of arithmos, “counting” as “bad procedure,” and rereading the rhythmos of Democritus, which philosophy has never been able to reckon w/ (n’aura pu compter) > philosophy accounts for itself by rising out of, and then circulating w/in its speculative necessity, the [envelope of writing]
O.linkedContent: le détour d’une écriture dont one ne revient pas, dissemination: this question calls for restaging of arithmos, “counting” as “bad procedure,” and rereading the rhythmos of Democritus, which philosophy has never been able to reckon w/ (n’aura pu compter) > philosophy accounts for itself by rising out of, and then circulating w/in its speculative necessity, the [envelope of writing]

O.content: for Hegel, philosophy is unique, must produce object & method out of its own interiority
O.linkedContent: for Hegel, philosophy is unique, must produce object & method out of its own interiority

DPi.content: daimon (for Socrates) silent before law: philosophy finds its place in this silence of the daimon at moment of condemnation
DPi.linkedContent: daimon (for Socrates) silent before law: philosophy finds its place in this silence of the daimon at moment of condemnation

CHM.content: philosophy as this giant confession: attempt-to-say-the-hyperbole (to define it as such is to confess) > I philosophize only in terror, but in confessed terror of going mad
CHM.linkedContent: philosophy as this giant confession: attempt-to-say-the-hyperbole (to define it as such is to confess) > I philosophize only in terror, but in confessed terror of going mad

CHM.content: confession is simultaneously: oblivion/unveiling, protection/exposure > economy

DST.content: hantise (obsessive fear), the way in which philosophy is haunted, visited, inhabited by madness > there is a domesticity of “philosophical madness”
DST.linkedContent: hantise (obsessive fear), the way in which philosophy is haunted, visited, inhabited by madness > there is a domesticity of “philosophical madness”

RM.content: closure is not a circular limit (bordering homogenous field), but a more twisted (plus retorse) structure, another figure: “invaginated” (there is never “the” metaphysical”)
RM.linkedContent: closure is not a circular limit (bordering homogenous field), but a more twisted (plus retorse) structure, another figure: “invaginated” (there is never “the” metaphysical”)

RM.content: representation of a linear & circular closure surrounding a homogenous space is a self-representation of philosophy in its onto-encyclopedic logic
RM.linkedContent: representation of a linear & circular closure surrounding a homogenous space is a self-representation of philosophy in its onto-encyclopedic logic

AFR.content: philosophy is historical for Condillac: it always comes after cognition, after a scientific discovery; his philosophical method can only be established après coup—or stroke (coup) of genius
AFR.linkedContent: philosophy is historical for Condillac: it always comes after cognition, after a scientific discovery; his philosophical method can only be established après coup—or stroke (coup) of genius

AFR.content: for Condillac, philosopher forms new combination of ideas re: combination of ideas
AFR.linkedContent: for Condillac, philosopher forms new combination of ideas re: combination of ideas

AFR.content: Condillac against frivolous obscurantism, erudition, against philosophers (inventors of prose) who did not “witness[ ]…impressions they caused” (unlike poets, orators), nor did they find rule of their discourse in “live interchange” > frivolous style is that of the written
AFR.linkedContent: Condillac against frivolous obscurantism, erudition, against philosophers (inventors of prose) who did not “witness[ ]…impressions they caused” (unlike poets, orators), nor did they find rule of their discourse in “live interchange” > frivolous style is that of the written

TN.content: Nancy: philosophy as work of mourning, work of representation, incorporation, profits from death (jouir de la mort), philosophy doesn’t know true mourning (w/out limits: ashes & tears)
TN.linkedContent: Nancy: philosophy as work of mourning, work of representation, incorporation, profits from death (jouir de la mort), philosophy doesn’t know true mourning (w/out limits: ashes & tears)

TN.content: for Nancy, touching the limit > moment of decision
TN.linkedContent: for Nancy, touching the limit > moment of decision

TN.content: philosophy, literally, has never touched anything > inversely, all one ever does is touch a limit (destiny of this figurality) [hymen]; to touch is to touch a limit, a surface, a border, an outline
TN.linkedContent: philosophy, literally, has never touched anything > inversely, all one ever does is touch a limit (destiny of this figurality) [hymen]; to touch is to touch a limit, a surface, a border, an outline

TN.content: touch untouchable-touchable surface/border/limit on exposing edge of an abyss
TN.linkedContent: touch untouchable-touchable surface/border/limit on exposing edge of an abyss

TN.content: philosophy will have “touched” something 2x: limit & unfoundable abyss beneath/beyond it
TN.linkedContent: philosophy will have “touched” something 2x: limit & unfoundable abyss beneath/beyond it

TN.content: there can only be a figure of touch, one only touches by way of figure > the object, the touchable thing, the "thing itself,” is the untouchable (gives itself, opens only in history of figure)
TN.linkedContent: there can only be a figure of touch, one only touches by way of figure > the object, the touchable thing, the "thing itself,” is the untouchable (gives itself, opens only in history of figure)

TN.content: philosophy—idealization, intuitionism as philosophy itself, where seeing the blind spot, a point, is touching it > fullness of immediate presence: actuality of what se donne en acte, energetically, effectively: hapto-tropologic metaphysics comes to its plenitude, pleroma
TN.linkedContent: philosophy—idealization, intuitionism as philosophy itself, where seeing the blind spot, a point, is touching it > fullness of immediate presence: actuality of what se donne en acte, energetically, effectively: hapto-tropologic metaphysics comes to its plenitude, pleroma

TN.content: Novalis: only authentic philosophical act is suicide > first kiss and suicide [?]
TN.linkedContent: Novalis: only authentic philosophical act is suicide > first kiss and suicide [?]

AD.content: philosophy, whose status is governed and whose signature is legitimated by the question
AD.linkedContent: philosophy, whose status is governed and whose signature is legitimated by the question

OG.content: Rousseau: philosophy/reason introduces self-love, philosophy permits man to speak in secret—“‘perish if you will, I’m secure’”
OG.linkedContent: Rousseau: philosophy/reason introduces self-love, philosophy permits man to speak in secret—“‘perish if you will, I’m secure’”

OG.content: if philosophy is the invention of prose, the becoming-prose of the world, poet excluded more from writing than from city
OG.linkedContent: if philosophy is the invention of prose, the becoming-prose of the world, poet excluded more from writing than from city

WAP.content: philosophy has no horizon, if horizon means a limit, a line that encircles or delimits a perspective (interdisciplinarity: more horizontal identities than ever)
WAP.linkedContent: philosophy has no horizon, if horizon means a limit, a line that encircles or delimits a perspective (interdisciplinarity: more horizontal identities than ever)

WAP.content: philosophy, by right, must claim to be justified, at every moment (thus rupture), to put into question every “presupposition” (incl. those of “philosophy”) > vertical self-institution
WAP.linkedContent: philosophy, by right, must claim to be justified, at every moment (thus rupture), to put into question every “presupposition” (incl. those of “philosophy”) > vertical self-institution

WAP.content: not every community will be philosophical that practices skepsis, epochē, doubt, irony questioning, but no philosophy w/out reexamining in every possible fashion
WAP.linkedContent: not every community will be philosophical that practices skepsis, epochē, doubt, irony questioning, but no philosophy w/out reexamining in every possible fashion

WAP.content: fidelity to an absolute quasi-contract w/ no history: not irresponsibility, but more imperative one, right not to have to appear before (account to) this or that regime (of appearing)
WAP.linkedContent: fidelity to an absolute quasi-contract w/ no history: not irresponsibility, but more imperative one, right not to have to appear before (account to) this or that regime (of appearing)

WAP.content: double bind of philosophical commitment or pledge (droit, if a philosopheme, also submitted to law of double bind: unstable, deconstructible, it precedes itself, calls for indestructible responsibility)
WAP.linkedContent: double bind of philosophical commitment or pledge (droit, if a philosopheme, also submitted to law of double bind: unstable, deconstructible, it precedes itself, calls for indestructible responsibility)

WAP.content: indestructible responsibility (because always revived in anxious raising of stakes [relancée dans une surenchère inquiète]) makes good conscience impossible
WAP.linkedContent: indestructible responsibility (because always revived in anxious raising of stakes [relancée dans une surenchère inquiète]) makes good conscience impossible

WAP.content: philosophical determination of indestructible responsibility, concepts of its axiomatics (will, subject, “I” w/ free will, property, self-presence of intention), can always be deconstructed
WAP.linkedContent: philosophical determination of indestructible responsibility, concepts of its axiomatics (will, subject, “I” w/ free will, property, self-presence of intention), can always be deconstructed

WAP.content: name “philosophy” submitted to a torsion that folds it back toward excessive, unbounded (débordant), inexhaustible place (lieu)
WAP.linkedContent: name “philosophy” submitted to a torsion that folds it back toward excessive, unbounded (débordant), inexhaustible place (lieu)

WAP.content: thing or concept “philosophy,” its title, always unequal to the responsibility that, in its name, carries beyond its name
WAP.linkedContent: thing or concept “philosophy,” its title, always unequal to the responsibility that, in its name, carries beyond its name

WAP.content: philosopher, disturbing thinker, always accused of impiety because takes uncertainty, chance, tukhē seriously; Cicero claims Theophrastus said: “fortune is queen of the world”
WAP.linkedContent: philosopher, disturbing thinker, always accused of impiety because takes uncertainty, chance, tukhē seriously; Cicero claims Theophrastus said: “fortune is queen of the world”

WAP.content: philosophy as most economical practice of natural language [?]: must know its virtual folds, potentialities, rhetorical effects
WAP.linkedContent: philosophy as most economical practice of natural language [?]: must know its virtual folds, potentialities, rhetorical effects

WAP.content: philosophy does not completely belong to culture
WAP.linkedContent: philosophy does not completely belong to culture

WAP.content: la philosophie se tient sous cette loi qui veut que le droit à la philosophie ne s'arrête jamais, never give up on irony, skepsis, epochē, or doubt (when facing any philosopheme)
WAP.linkedContent: la philosophie se tient sous cette loi qui veut que le droit à la philosophie ne s'arrête jamais, never give up on irony, skepsis, epochē, or doubt (when facing any philosopheme)

WAP.content: how dominant philosophical culture tends to censor other philosophical discourses or other discourses that exceed philosophico-juridico-political machinery
WAP.linkedContent: how dominant philosophical culture tends to censor other philosophical discourses or other discourses that exceed philosophico-juridico-political machinery

WAP.content: irresponsibility to state can be demanded by philosophy’s responsibility to its own law (to thinking) > gives itself right or privilege to go on questioning w/out trusting limit inside/outside
WAP.linkedContent: irresponsibility to state can be demanded by philosophy’s responsibility to its own law (to thinking) > gives itself right or privilege to go on questioning w/out trusting limit inside/outside

WAP.content: Derrida does not multiply remarks on structure of reference, article of title, value of contextuality [i.e. minutiae, syntax] to divert from urgency, but to determine it by exposing 2 alibis of philosophy: 1) imperialist self-confidence of philosophy: exists in its self-critique, is the paideia of self-critique, always in crisis, critical instance of judging, self-repetition via krinein 2) [see p. 107 nationalization of “teaching”?]
WAP.linkedContent: Derrida does not multiply remarks on structure of reference, article of title, value of contextuality [i.e. minutiae, syntax] to divert from urgency, but to determine it by exposing 2 alibis of philosophy: 1) imperialist self-confidence of philosophy: exists in its self-critique, is the paideia of self-critique, always in crisis, critical instance of judging, self-repetition via krinein 2) [see p. 107 nationalization of “teaching”?]

WAP.content: these are alibis because philosophy, and via deconstruction, has exceeded this schema, a “crisis of crisis”
WAP.linkedContent: these are alibis because philosophy, and via deconstruction, has exceeded this schema, a “crisis of crisis”

WAP.content: philosophy is ontology, its paideia is an encyclopedia
WAP.linkedContent: philosophy is ontology, its paideia is an encyclopedia

WAP.content: Hegel: the contents of philosophy are the same as religion [form is different]

WAP.content: interest in/of philosophy not a frightened fetishism, if it exists: an affirmation that knows no limits

WOG.content: undecidability found a certain privilege in ‘Greek’ words, in philosophy, on [sur?] its borders, that is, beyond its confines [pharmakon, hymen, parergon]

ATAP.content: acc. Kant, philosopher and shopkeeper write in prose

EU.content: to feel despair, there must be a basic fund of philosophical reaffirmation, necessity of link btwn reaffirmation of philosophy & a kind of deconstructive writing [reflux]

EU.content: [CIPH] no preinterpretation, “thinking” as what questions philosophy > indeterminate opening (experimental incursions in unexplored areas)

SPEC.content: no theses in science or literature (athetic), every thesis is philosophical
